testproblem.name: radial-viscous-free-surfaceThis tests that the normals used in the free surface boundary condition are purely in the radial direction. The test case prescribes a purely rotational velocity field at the surface boundary, with a free-slip base. The free surface height should therefore be zero. If radial directions are not purely orthogonal to the prescribed tangential velocities, this is not the case.

problem_definition.command_line: mpiexec flredecomp -i 1 -o 4 radial-viscous-fs P4-radial-viscous-fs && mpiexec fluidity -v2 -l P4-radial-viscous-fs.flml

variables.variable: import os files = os.listdir("./") solvers_converged = not "matrixdump" in files and not "matrixdump.info" in files
from fluidity_tools import stat_parser stat=stat_parser('free_surface.stat') abs_free_surface = max(abs(stat['Mantle']['FreeSurface']['max']),abs(stat['Mantle']['FreeSurface']['min']))
